vel_data_structures package¶

Submodules¶

vel_data_structures.AVL module¶

A multi-set that is implemented using an AVL tree https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVL_tree

@author: Alfredo Velasco

class vel_data_structures.AVL.AVL(items=None)¶

Bases: object

Represents an AVL tree

add(item)¶

Adds an item to the tree

Parameters

item – The item to be inserted

contains(item)¶

Indicates if you item is in the tree

Parameters

item – the item to find in the tree

Return bool

if the item was found in the tree

items_yield()¶

Generator function that iterates DFS through the items in the tree

Return item

The items in the tree

remove(item)¶

Removes an item from the tree

Parameters

item – The item to be deleted

Raises

KeyError – if item is not in the tree

to_dot(f_name)¶

This method writes out the AVL to a .dot file so that it can be visualized by graphviz.

Parameters

f_name (str) – the name of the files

Raises

Exception – if the f_name has a non .dot extension

vel_data_structures.AVL.main()¶

vel_data_structures.AVL_Dict module¶

A python dictionary implemented using an AVL tree https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AVL_tree

@author: Alfredo Velasco

class vel_data_structures.AVL_Dict.AVL_Dict(items=None)¶

Bases: object

A dictionary that uses an AVL tree

add(key, val)¶

Adds a key-val pair to the tree

Parameters

  • key – The key to be inserted

  • val – The value to which key maps

clear()¶

Deletes all of the items in the tree

get(key)¶

Returns the value to which key maps

Parameters

key – The key whose mapping we’ll retreive

Return val

The value to which key maps

items_yield()¶

Generator function that iterates DFS through the (key, value) pairs in the tree

Returns (key, val)

The key-value pairs in the tree

keys_yield()¶

Generator function that iterates DFS through the keys in the tree

Returns key

The keys in the tree

remove(key)¶

Removes an item from the tree

Parameters

key – the key to be deleted

Raises

KeyError – if key is not in the tree

vel_data_structures.BTree module¶

vel_data_structures.BTree.get_insertion_index(item, l)¶

Returns the position where item should be inserted so that l stays sorted

Parameters

  • l – the list where item could be inserted

Retun index

the index where item would be inserted

  • item – the item to insert

  • l – the list where item will be inserted

vel_data_structures.Ring_Buffer module¶

A ring buffer. This is a queue that can hold only n items at most.

@author: Alfredo Velasco

class vel_data_structures.Ring_Buffer.Ring_Buffer(capacity)¶

Bases: object

A ring buffer of size n

capacity()¶

Returns the capacity of this ring buffer.

Returns int capacity

the capacity

dequeue()¶

Deletes and returns the item at the front of this ring buffer.

Returns item

the first item in the queue

Raises

Exception – if the ring buffer is empty

enqueue(x)¶

Adds item x to the end of this ring buffer.

Parameters

x – the item to insert

Raises

Exception – if the ring buffer is full

isEmpty()¶

Is this ring buffer empty (size equals zero)?

Returns bool

is size is 0

isFull()¶

Is this ring buffer full (size equals capacity)?

Returns bool

if size == capacity

peek()¶

Returns the item at the front of this ring buffer.

Returns item

the first item in the queue

Raises

Exception – if the ring buffer is empty

size()¶

Returns the number of items currently in this ring buffer.

Returns int size

the number of items in the queue
